summary: An email from an FBI SSA in Squad C-20 (VCAC/Human Trafficking) sent on July 2, 2019, notifying team members of Jeffrey Epstein's indictment and arrest warrant in the SDNY. The email outlines immediate operational plans for his arrest upon return to the U.S., execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, interviews with co-conspirators, and deployment of agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview individuals.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant issued by the SDNY; believed to be in France at the time of the email.

persons.name: SSA - Squad C-20 VCAC/Human Trafficking
persons.context: The sender of the email, coordinating the FBI squad's response to Epstein's indictment, including planning for arrest, search warrants, and interviews.

connections.description: The FBI SSA is leading the squad responsible for planning the arrest and investigation of Epstein following his indictment.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York, and an arrest warrant was sworn out for him.

events.title: FBI Operational Planning
events.description: The FBI's Squad C-20 begins immediate planning for Epstein's arrest upon his return to the U.S., execution of a search warrant at his NYC residence, interviews with co-conspirators, and deployment of agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview individuals.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019, with an arrest warrant issued.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the United States.
The FBI's operational plan included executing a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence and interviewing co-conspirators.
The FBI also planned to deploy two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and attempt to interview 1-3 individuals there.
The email indicates the investigation was being handled by the FBI's Squad C-20, which focuses on VCAC (Violent Crimes Against Children) and Human Trafficking.
